metadata.title: CVE-2019-12495 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Tiny C Compiler (aka TinyCC or TCC) 0.9.27.Compiling a crafted source file leads to a one-byte out-of-bounds write inthe gsym_addr function in x86_64-gen.c. This occurs because tccasm.cmishandles section switches.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12495` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

tcc - 0.9.27+git20200814.62c30a4a-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tcc package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.9.27+git20200814.62c30a4a-1').
